text: Ghorst traverses the forsaken realm as he did the roads of the Empire, as a groom, before the study of necromancy consumed his every waking moment.
Mastery of the dark arts has imbued Ghorst with preternatural strength, enabling him to easily hold his own in combat.
Over time, Ghorst's skin has toughened like that of a corpse, causing arrows and sword-blows that would normally kill a man to merely glance off.
Having survived the deadly Plague of Blue Roses, even after deliberately infecting himself, Ghorst can easily recover from lesser wounds and sicknesses.
By which those caught in Ghorst's Danse Macabre are hurled forward into the fray, becoming far more lethal whilst the spell lasts.
Alberic is courageous and loves to be in the thick of battle, inspiring the rest of the army to valorous deeds.
Alberic's navy helps shipbuilding materials and provisions get to coastal settlements, allowing them to prosper.
Bordeleaux's sea routes were once used by the Elven colonists; now they serve Alberic's people.
The duke appoints administrators amongst the smallfolk, who are familiar with local issues.
The Fay is the spiritual representation of the Lady, her blessing upon a shrine can bring the goddess close.
Those touched by the Grail are utterly devoted and would lay down their life for the Fay Enchantress.
The magic of the Fay Enchantress is fundamentally tied to the lands of the Bretonni.
The Enchantress gathers the young and brings them to the otherworld, where some are blessed to return as damsels.
The king has the power to bestow titles on those with honour.
Not since Gilles the Uniter has the Royarch of Bretonnia been so respected.
The barracks are full in anticipation of the king calling the next Errantry War.
As the paragon of chivalry, the king's behaviour reflects on all touched by the Lady.
An audacious surprise attack on his predecessor has led to a new title for Tretch and an army to do his bidding.
The monarch of the Undead, the liege of the Unliving.
The ties that hold man and beast together cannot be broken by death alone.
This Liche Priest is so powerful he can tap energy directly from the Realm of Souls and direct it at will.
Effective chariot warfare requires precise control - choreography, almost, if you will - if the victories sought by Unliving generals are to be achieved.
This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of course…
Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.
Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.
Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.
The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.
Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.
This Necrotect knows all the secret hieroglyphic inscriptions required to strengthen his statuary constructs.
The myriad Undead legions respond to their master's will without question.
As the embodiment of the Asp Goddess in full fury, a wave of pure terror rolls over those who look upon her.
The oldest and wisest of the Liche Priests is the head of the Mortuary Cult's hieratic council.
Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Years…
Unlife is forever; it is therefore prudent to go willingly and prepared.
There are many perfectly-uttered litanies and precise incantations required to draw forth spirits from the Realm of Souls. This one knows them all.
The Vulture-God assists the desert poozler, lest they lose their way 'neath the scorching desert sun.
Imbued with the souls of ancient Liche Priests, Sokth's servants are unhindered by their mechanical bodies of metal and stone.
That which is sculpted in Qu'aph's noble image strikes with the strength of the Serpent-God.
Settra is a brutal warlord and powerful sorcerer combined to deadly effect; ageless, deathless, venomous, and almost entirely without peer.
The stuff of myth and nightmares made stone, and later terrifying, savage reality.
The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.
The people of the desert live and die by their oaths in Basth's graceful sight.
Djaf's servants bring brutal, jackal-headed death to his unfortunate foes.
Benevolent Tahoth imparts sacred knowledge and timeless wisdom to his people.
The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.
We'll be back. We're coming back in here.
Tretch's sneaky, ultra-duplicitous tactics are dirty, even by Skaven low standards!
It's not running away. It's knowing when and where to be to secure the best advantage.
A master of exploiting others' weaknesses, Tretch and his band are never where you expect them and always where they can do most damage.
I turned around and they'd run-scurried off! Covering that distance in no time at all? It can't be natural, yes-yes!
It should be no surprise that a race without a shred of honour or decency between them have even less regard for each other's lives.
Reborn at last, the Liche King has returned to take revenge on all Nehekhara.
As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.
Dying has not proved a hindrance to Arkhan, so strong are his skills on the field of battle.
Although not as numerous as Settra's grand army, Arkhan's Undead legions are bolstered by the Liche King's unparalleled Necromantic dexterity.
The monarch of the Undead, the liege of the Unliving.
The first and most loyal of the Great Necromancer's followers will stand at his side once again. So it is written…
Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.
Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.
Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.
The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening.
Not even stone is set in stone it seems – arcane death magic is used to bring tortured, savage vigour to once-dormant stone sentinels.
Simple stone is afforded more respect than other materials, for from its grain giant guardians are hewn, brought to shuddering life by the Liche Priests' sorcery.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.
The desert itself is his steed.
A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.
The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.
To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Symbolising immortality and eternity, the ruler of the Nehekharan Pantheon has always had a care for the wellbeing of his children.
They stand staring into the sun for eternity, the physical embodiment of the everlasting gods. Terrible ye who looked into their divine forms!
Those who oppose the faceless God of the Underworld shall suffer terribly, condemned to its lowest levels for eternity.
They who serve the Asp Goddess are blessed with a precise aim with which to reach their objectives.
Whenever Khalida awakens, the power of the Asp Goddess floods her body, infusing life and power into her mummified remains so that she may defeat her enemies.
Saved from the Blood Kiss at the hands of her cousin Neferata, Khalida was cleansed of evil by the Goddess of Beauty and Vengeance.
The magnificent tomb city is renowned for its Undead archers, pledged to serve the High Queen for eternity.
Those pledged to fight for Asaph also worship Khalida, her physical embodiment in full, furious Unlife.
The venom running through Khalida's veins enables her to move with the speed of a striking asp.
Her legendary intelligence, temperament and personal bravery make Khalida stand out, even from the extraordinary ranks of the immortal Tomb Kings.
Some knowledge is so dangerous that it is revealed only to those deemed worthy of the responsibility.
Only those who display the correct degree of diligence and reverence may learn the secrets of Unlife.
When the souls are released they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.
By which the very souls of the Undead can be harnessed, so their physical forms can be controlled.
Killed him? No, I did not - I gave him life!
By which a whirling cloud of sand and dust is conjured to confound the foe's armies and magic-users.
Like their riders, fallen mounts can be brought back to spitting, snorting Unlife, and bound in servitude.
Nehekhara's scrolls and relics must be guarded if Settra's Golden Age is to be restored.
Ancient beyond memory, Khatep has denied death's cold embrace for centuries, and will continue to do so.
The oldest and wisest of the Liche Priests is the head of the Mortuary Cult's hieratic council.
Under Settra's iron-fisted rule, war-ravaged cities and monuments to the Nehekharan gods were restored; there was plenty and prosperity for all, and there will be again.
Knowing your way around the Realm of Souls, along with knowledge of the required ritual incantations, are essential skills for the dedicated Liche Priest.
When intoned, this ritual text holds back decay so the Tomb Kings' souls can be bound to their mortal remains once more.
There are specialised rituals, chants and incantations for drawing forth dead spirits and binding them back into their corporeal forms; this one knows them all.
The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.
It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
A reward for utter dedication to the Warrior-Queen, every swipe of its sandstone tail can carve through mortal flesh.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Its wheels ablaze with a mystical flame, the blessings of the gods are carried by this mighty chariot.
Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Reaching behind the wall of death to bring back the soul and bind it to you takes skill, but like anything, practice makes perfect!
The strength at the base of the pillar; the venom of the cobra and the asp.
Hatred this strong is infectious, contagious, and inescapable.
Intensifying the chanting of sinister mantras, the Necrotects redouble their efforts to preserve and finish their restorative works.
This intricate hieroglyphic engraving aids the Necrotect's drive to restore his Tomb King's monuments to their former glory.
The faces of the gods gaze down from their daises, imposing monuments to Nehekhara's former prestige.
The master of the necrotectural art understands all aspects of the construction process; inspiration, labour, time and cost are all within his Undead grasp.
No expense was spared in sculpting a Hierotitan - the greatest and most talented of Necrotects were contracted to work on the blessed stone that would form these gigantic statues.

To carve a Necrosphinx is to manifest the greatest and most destructive creature of the underworld. Not all Necrotects were adept at bringing such constructions to Unlife - only the most gifted of their trade even dare.

The leonine statues, known as Warsphinxes, were first constructed in Khemri; and so it is Necrotects who hail from the first city are the greatest carvers of these magnificent and deadly stone beasts.
Animated by a ceremony of awakening, the Tomb Scorpion's carapace is infused with residual power from the corpse within to swarm and kill the enemies of its master.
The secrets of the desert reveal themselves to the unwary trespasser.
Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.
Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.
By which the dead don't stay that way for long, springing back into jerking, clanking Unlife.
Sword-blows are mysteriously turned away as Ptra's wife reaches out to shield Nehekhara's warriors from evil.
Sword-blows are mysteriously turned away as Ptra's wife reaches out to shield Nehekhara's warriors from evil.
When the verses are spoken, a fierce light emanates from the Undead's empty eye-sockets, enabling them to strike with supernatural speed and fury.
When the verses are spoken, a fierce light emanates from the Undead's empty eye-sockets, enabling them to strike with supernatural speed and fury.
As the names of Usirian are invoked, skeletal hands burst forth from beneath the sand to drag the foe to their graves.
As the names of Usirian are invoked, skeletal hands burst forth from beneath the sand to drag the foe to their graves.
Every syllable strips moisture and saps vitality from the bodies of Usekhp's unfortunate victims.
Every syllable strips moisture and saps vitality from the bodies of Usekhp's unfortunate victims.
A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.
A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.
This is just the beginning. When the Great Necromancer returns, all around will be laid waste!
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
Every move is perfectly choreographed, as if it were a dance… a dance of death.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.
Inalienable and unassailable in all things, Settra's strength is such that he never needs to return to his sarcophagus.
Settra's thirst for conquest knows no bounds; time itself is not safe from his ambition.
The jewel in Nehekhara's crown was founded by Settra; the mightiest city of the Tomb Kings' absolute sovereign ruler.
In Nehekhara, those sworn to serve its rulers do not stay 'properly' dead for long.
Time itself is not safe from Settra's unquenchable wrath; all will be crushed beneath the wheels of his chariots.
Settra is brutal warlord and powerful sorcerer combined to deadly effect; ageless, deathless, venomous, and almost entirely without peer.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
This complex distillation not only preserves the drinker in glorious Unlife, it also increases their physical resistance to attack.
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.
The firstborn son of a Tomb King is given to the gods, where he may serve the future itself as part of the Mortuary Cult.
The second son of a second son shall succeed his father when the time comes. It is the custom.
The younger sons of a Tomb King command detachments within his armies, ensuring their father's unshakeable, iron will is enacted to the letter.
Those sons not given to serve the Mortuary Cult shall instead serve in their sovereign’s eternal council of war.
To challenge the might of long-established Nehekharan dynasties is to risk the wrath of the desert’s most reputable sons.
My name was etched in gold long before your ancestors even knew how to speak.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.
Where the Blood Queen treads, murder follows in her wake.
The need for blood - to bathe in its viscous goodness - will always drive the Crone of Har Ganeth onward.
Witch Elves are drawn to their monarch, for no other commands Khaine's word like she.
Khaine's favour is bestowed on those that seek to bring murder into the world.
As Khaine's chosen bride, she is his champion and envoy, and no harm will come to her.
The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Whether Elf, Dwarf, or man, their souls now serve the pleasure of the Blood Queen.
Give in to the Blood Queen's affection - her love is so intense as to kill.
Why stop at one, when you can have two?
With enough sacrifices, the deepest secrets of the Cauldron of Blood will be yours.
Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
Dark, feral death indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.
To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.
There are none more adept at metal-shaping than those who command the runes.
The Sisters of Avelorn are the Everqueen's chosen guardians and they aspire to perfection in mind, body and spirit.
She is the Radiant – Isha's chosen – her beauty radiating not merely from without but from within.
All Asur adore the Everqueen, but Alarielle is especially beloved for her willingness to join warriors in battle.
The Everqueen does not traditionally go to war, but Alarielle is different - she will punish the invaders of Avelorn!
Representing the Isha and all the Gods of the Cadai, the Everqueen is a beacon of hope in these turbulent times.
A gift from Isha; no wounds are beyond Alarielle's skills and her wards of protection know no equal.
As guardian of the lands, the Everqueen can manipulate the Lores of Life and Light with unrivalled skill.
An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.
Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.
While Alarielle herself is seen as a radical force, she is bound to certain ceremonial duties, which is reassuring for many Asur.
Elves are political creatures, but the Everqueen exists above such debased notions; when she speaks all listen and put aside petty machinations.
As a paragon of the Earth Mother and queen of Avelorn, growth and fortitude for the land itself is promoted.
The spiritual defence and well-being of the Elves is the traditional duty of the Everqueen.
The Everqueen can banish the taint of Chaos with a single touch.
Isha's blessing is only granted to the worthy - those who seek to protect life rather than take it.
Those of a fell heart will be destroyed if they receive the Everqueen's touch.
Isha's protection can protect the faithful Asur through the darkest of days.
Using the tricks of Loec, the Shadow King excels at remaining unseen, allowing him to go almost anywhere.
While there are traitors and minions of Malekith abroad, the Shadow King cannot – must not – rest.
Alith Anar is willing to use any means to destroy his enemies; his vengeance has no limits.
An unseen force, returned to take vengeance on those who have wronged the loyal folk of Nagarythe.
Led by their king, the deadly Shadow Warriors are the most ruthless of all Ulthuan's warlike children.
As he is a master of ambushes and surviving certain death, the prospect of facing Alith Anar is always a deadly one.
He will look for you, he will find you, and he will kill you.
He may lurk in the Shadows, but Alith Anar is as much royalty as any of Ulthuan's princes.
An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
As an envoy of Alarielle, the Handmaiden speaks with the authority of the Everqueen.
In a culture where words can cut as deeply as blades, a tactful speech can stop conflicts and waylay wars.
Not all intentions need be hidden behind words and poetry; sometimes, good diplomacy is direct diplomacy.
A secret kept is a favour to be returned at a later time.
The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.
The Handmaiden's actions have gleaned the favour of the Earth Goddess.
One of the Everqueen's inner circle; highly trusted, they will gladly die for the Everqueen if called upon to do so.
Handmaidens, like many Elves, excel at missile weapons, but this one's eye is especially keen.
A mistress of the bow, able to loose an arrow before a man can complete a blink.
The eyes of the hawk, able to pluck a falling hair with a deft arrow sent from her bow.
To protect and guard the Everqueen is an eternal honour and one that no Handmaiden has ever refused.
Do not mistake the title of Handmaiden as a serf, for they are warriors all, and incredibly powerful ones at that.
As a guardian, the Warrioress is sworn to protect everything that Asur hold dear.
Avelorn's shield protects its forests and queen, and is blessed with preternatural grace.
This warrior is one with their spear; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.
An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.
There is no-one more devoted to murder than Crone Hellebron, greatest of all Khaine’s brides.
As Everqueen of all Asur, Alarielle is leader of Avelorn and Ulthuan’s spiritual head.
Where Alith Anar stalks, so come the ravens to feast on the carrion in the Shadow King’s wake.
If there's a right way to do something, this one doesn't have the wherewithal to know what it is.
This one is something of an eccentric; their erratic behaviour has upset powerful people, which is seldom a good idea.
Don't take this one along if you need to get away quickly… or maybe you should…
This one doesn't even relax in their own company, so reserved is their nature.
Some things should not have to be endured.
Action, inaction, change - you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.
On occasion, throwing the whole nine leagues at the enemy is just the ticket.
Skills refined and improved upon over time can only increase one's edge over the foe.
You don't want to be on the wrong side of this one's ire - it's explosive to say the least!
The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.
Every fibre of their being is charged and ready for action - wherever, whenever.
Impressively energetic for a thousand years old - even by their own reckoning.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.
Hmmm interesting. I do wonder if there's a third way, however…
There's usually a right way and a wrong way to do anything. This one generally gets it wrong.
This one can never leave something alone. They always have to meddle.
Good ideas oft-times need vocal, public support to turn them into reality.
The Daemon is very definitely in the detail…
Armies can be mended as surely as people can, up to a point of course.
This one acts not for themselves but the for the greater good, in defence of the future.
Fortunately, there are some who really apply themselves to the problems of the world. Just as well, otherwise we'd be… Oh wait...
There's always a way - always an angle. You just have to find it.
Never short of new ideas, or new ways of looking at old problems.
An individual of exceptional skill and worth; the very embodiment of sagacity.
I see something wrong and I fix it with my hands.
Smuggling, racketeering, bootlegging – all in a day’s work for the enterprising pirate!
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me.
If there's swash to be buckled, this one will be right at the front, in the thick of the fray.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
The strength and agility of the Vampire comes from a place beyond: the supernatural realm of the Unliving.
Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!
Sheer, undiluted spite sharpens the dead eye further.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.
The tidal currents shall slow the foe's advance.
No matter how far away, none can escape the Kiss of the Deep, nor breathe again with lungs full of seawater.
All manner of creatures infest the deep, many who have never - and should never - be seen above the waves.
All manner of creatures infest the deep, many who have never - and should never - be seen above the waves.
As surely as night follows day, when the mist descends, death isn't far behind.
As surely as night follows day, when the mist descends, death isn't far behind.
Once the mighty Kraken's tentacles take hold, only the toughest can fight their way free.
Once the mighty Kraken's tentacles take hold, only the toughest can fight their way free.
No one sails this ship of fools.
No one sails this ship of fools.
Sheer, undiluted spite sharpens the dead eye further.
Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.
Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.
The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.
Those who serve the Lady purely are rewarded with a portion of her strength when battle is joined.
Many Bretonnian veterans speak of a soothing presence felt on occasion in the heat of battle, helping them to find their mark and keep their cool.
Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.
Even dull and stupid peasants can aim a bow, but with a little training they can learn to shoot with some success.
There are literally no opponents too great for them to face down. None.
When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...
Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.
The Beastlord truly has no mercy – those who flee will soon find all paths lead to a brutal end by arrow or axe.
Only a select few from a herd gain their Beastlord's acknowledgement – a prize earned through the carnage and chaos they spread in battle.
The Beastmen’s elite menagerie – the brayherds – slaughter all those caught in their savage, animalistic sights.
Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.
A summons to war in which all are drawn into the cacophonous charge; glory or sanguine death is the prize.
These colossal, brutish warriors are the core of any true brayherd.
At the head of the warherd, he whips his followers into a frothing furore, then unleashes them upon the enemy.
The stench of magic is palpable. No mage can stand in the midst of battle against the baying warherds.
The Beastman delights in constant fighting; in vicious, ceaseless brutality. It gives him purpose.
The desire to wreak havoc is innate, brought about not by choice but by sheer force of being.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
Unnatural strength, an aura of dark menace, an unwavering devotion to the Chaos Gods – some warriors have undoubtedly been touched by the Ruinous Ones.
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.
Subdue the enemy with savage fire, as flaming projectiles burn a trail across the sky.
Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.
To devastate one's enemies from afar is the key to controlling the battlefield.
Breaking bones and ending lives, the armies of Chaos strike like an unholy hammer crashing through their enemies' ranks.
The legions march forth under the Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.
Hulks of pure muscle, held upright by unsullied hatred, can crush a man with a frightening lack of effort.
The Daemons of Chaos bay for blood, spurred on by a chorus of agonised screams.
The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to move faster for longer.
Why would one pretend to be what he is not? There are many reasons, none of them innocent.
Why would one pretend to be what he is not? There are many reasons, none of them innocent.
Such methods are blunt and crude in the extreme, but still very, very effective.
If you're offering enough, most people eventually start to see things your way.
Some think her a freak abomination, but Manann's true and only daughter knows different.
In death, her brave former-adversary has proved a useful replacement for Aranessa's blasted limb.
Beasts of the sea, I command your allegiance…
Aranessa has been at sea since a very young age, so her talent for seafaring has had many years to flourish and grow.
Her very long tenure at sea, much of it spent relying on nothing but her own wits, means Aranessa has become quite skilled with a cannon.
You really don't want to run into this one, ever, under any circumstances... Yes, really.
Bone, muscle and sinew cannot always be relied upon to hold together unassisted.
Their rope skills are really rather excellent, considering how long the entire crew have been dead.
Surviving death tends to instil a certain toughness in one.
Now listen up an' listen good… here be the plan…
Death hasn't got in the way of this one's sure-shotted aim; in fact, if anything, he's got better.
You can't have too much of a good thing and a bit of what you fancy does no harm.
What has been seen cannot be unseen.
Like Unliving moths drawn inexorably towards a dazzling flame, the risen drowned strive - and stumble - to always be close to the one who has bound them.
Listen very carefully, me hearties, I shall say this only once… Quiet! Stromfels' stinkin' breath!
The once-men of the Undead legions march ever onwards, according to the will of their binder.
This is a dirty business, that much is certain, so why not get a little extra help to give yourself an edge?
Fire, to destroy all that you have done; fire, to end all you've become.
They could not break free, even if they wanted to.
Beware those who sail under the black flag - they give no quarter and never, ever give up the chase.
Cursed to haunt the waves forever, never finding rest or solace.
If it's not tacked down, this one'll 'ave it and kill anyone who gets in their way.
You'll never find such a crew - villainous scum, the lot of 'em. I certainly wouldn't want to be facing 'em in the thick of battle!
There's a time in every sailor's, er, life when the black flag seems like the best, if not the only option.
Deep within the boards and bulkheads, an intelligence stirs…
Such things keep the eternal players' of this world alive.
Take care of your ship and she will have a care for your wellbeing in return.
The dead rarely stay that way around these parts... and like to remind the living of their sins.
…and by the end the ocean itself was a deep red, like a vast vat of wine.
In truth, the oceans of this world are its largest cemetaries.
Some things should just never be brought over into the mortal world. Not ever.
To raise fallen champions such as these, in betrayal of The Lady to serve new masters, is profanation indeed!
Maybe Cylostra's dulcet tones sound like whalesong beneath the waves, calling the monsters of the deep to her service?
Such a strong emotion can summon the darkest forces imaginable to your side.
You don't want to get on her bad side… or any side, come to think of it!
Calm waters belie the lurching terror beneath.
The most fabulous voice in the world, ever. Obviously!
The blades of the dead cut deep and true, thrusted with endless supernatural strength.
He fights for a life once led now lost, brutally raging against the dying of the light.
Today is a good day to die; after all, who wants to live forever anyway?
…and like that it was gone. Along with the village and its inhabitants… Ne'er to be seen - or heard of - again.
Some beings just want to see the world burn.
Being shot at whilst covered in a foul, sticky mess is no picnic.
Assuming you get it right and your shot doesn't turn to flowers on impact, these little extras tend to bring advantage.
If all else fails, shoot it squarely and dive into the drink!
…because once they're in the water, you want your targets to stay there… forever.
Keep your tools on you at all times - you never know when you'll need them.
Definitely one to watch and perhaps align yourself with.
This one has a certain… energy and enthusiasm for the life, which is proving to be infectious.
Years at sea have clearly paid off - this one can clearly 'walk the walk', which has found favour with their crew.
People don't even speak in hushed tones anymore, such is this one's renown.
This terrifying Black Dragon, Fellheart's favourite mount, belches noxious fumes in place of fire as it carries the Krakenlord to battle.
Murder in the frontline, bang your head against the deck. The metal takes its price…
The Krakenlord comes from a very long line of raiders, admirals and map-makers; a chip off the old block, you might say!
The best sailors know their charts back to front and are always leagues ahead of the tide.
Showing his hand from the off, that there might be no confusion amongst his crews, Fellheart had his father's officers sacrificed to Mathlann.
Those unfortunates captured during a scrap will serve the Dreadfleet one way or another.
Never was a name so perfectly descriptive, and this one is their leader!
They'll never know the difference, even up close.

Some seafarers appear to have been born for the role.
The magical backlash Harkon suffered whilst trying to increase his power left him cut off from the Winds of Magic forever.
By which death is expertly dealt, assuming it doesn't blow your hand off in the process!
Sometimes, by chance it seems, the disparate threads are drawn together. Gods help you when they are.
His crimes are without number and his villainy without end… behold the Pirate King!
It's a rabbit's foot. A rabbit. No… Oh never mind - it brings me luck. It does! Trust me!
You'd better kill this one or they'll keep coming back until one of you is dead. Even then, there's no guarantee it'll be over!

This gigantic, reanimated hulk of flesh, timber and stone is one of the most fearsome things ever to lurch onto a battlefield.
Run true, for the frozen terror cometh; the Mourngul radiates a deathly chill that slows enemies, allowing it to go in for the kill.
An eternity of maddening hunger, from which there can be no release. It doesn't stop the Mourngul from trying, however.
From 'neath the swirling mist the Mourngul rises, bringing a terrible icy death in its dreadful wake.

Scream and shout 'til my dying breath, I'm gonna smash it up 'til there's nothing left!

Binding his crews together with the darkest of magics ensures that Noctilus' fleet cannot be beaten by force of arms alone.
Yes, they’re from the east. Annoying, yet useful - their hides, particularly…
You have to watch this one - when you shake their hand, count your fingers afterwards.
An all-but-unstoppable terror, when the Mournguls descend they rend and devour yet never know satisfaction.
If there's swash to be buckled, this one will be right at the front, in the thick of the fray.

Those who pass the trials of the Ancestor God have proven their honour without question.
None know the strength of the Dawi better than those who've suffered their firepower firsthand.
Only Dwarfen forges burn hotter than those unfortunates caught in the blaze of Dawi ingenuity.
Full of grim determination, when Dwarfs join battle there is no retreat, only victory or death.
All Dwarfs worship Grimnir, but only a select few warriors receive his personal recognition.
Morgrim's favour is not handed out on a whim; this god blesses only the truest disciples of Dawi engineering.
This Lord knows his throng thrives in ranged combat and expects his Clansdwarfs to excel in that discipline.
Dwarfs are long-lived with many years of battlefield experience, making them excellent tacticians.
The Dawi continually push the boundaries of engineering, be it by soaring ever higher in their flying contraptions or firing projectiles farther than ever before.
Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.
“We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”
Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.
Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.
Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.
This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.
The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.
These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.
The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.
Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.
Once trained to carry a man in battle, Imperial griffons are poised killers and incredibly dedicated to their riders.
An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.
Ridin’ on chariots means ya can be even more fighty, an' even more killy!
It’s one fing to be big, but quite anuva to be strong as well!
Even bigga than a Black Orc, an' not bad at killin’ too!
This Boss is one with "da boyz", egging the lads on to greater feats and to hit bigga stuff with their choppas.
Orcs may be stronger, but Goblins are smarter, nastier, and better-er.
This Boss realises the power of "flyin’ fings” and so invests a few teef in making sure his war machines can fling fings really far and really high!
Greenskin cavalry can be devastating if the myriad mounts can behave. Getting a big stick and maybe a "carrot" in the form of an orange-painted gobbo is the answer!
Nuffin' smashes harder than a rock fallin' from da sky, except mebbe da Bad Moon, if it were to fall.
The sneakiest and stabbiest gobbos are just as dangerous as the largest, fiercest Orcs.
Aranessa Saltspite is the most feared pirate in all of Sartosa, but none fear her more than the Norscan curs she hunts.
Beautiful and innocent it may be, but all will be consumed by fire in the end. It is written.
Cylostra is a vengeful spirit intent on performing for the Phoenix King, willing to sink all of Ulthuan to achieve her undying goal.
You'd think there wasn't much further to fall, but you'd be wrong - it's a long, long way down to Stromfels' Chest, after all…
Luthor Harkon has made many great cold-blooded enemies in his time, but his Undead army fear - and feel - nothing.
How else is an ordinary, decent pirate to make an honest living in these hard, dark times?
Killing is at the forefront of this one's mind. Hopefully, they also know how to run a ship.
Count Noctilus abandoned Sylvania to become the captain of the Dreadfleet and master of the Galleon's Graveyard; he is the foremost bringer of death upon the high seas.
It takes more than mere muscle to be leader, you must also know how to make money and how to inflict pain - a lot of pain.
There's nothing quite like a good, straightforward plan - and this is nothing like one! Complexity rarely trumps simplicity, in all matters.
Be the cargo powder, steel, gold or flesh, in the final analysis it matters not.
The greatest Corsair since the time of his illustrious grandfather, Lokhir is doing the name of Fellheart proud in every sense.
The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.
Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.
In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.
Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.
The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!
The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.
No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.
The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.
The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.
Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lord’s monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.
Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.
Can you hear it… the call of the night? Time for its children to arise and swarm.
By their very nature, most Vampires try to avoid discomfort and travel in style.
The Lord howls out into the night, and is answered by the baying of dark creatures.
The power of death cannot be denied.
The Undead Lord has followed the warrior's path to its ultimate conclusion, in a dark mockery of a Knight's vow.
Such evil spirits are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.
The Dark Magic-user can take to the skies, defying gravity by metamorphosing into a bat.
…and the legions of the dead envoked all hell upon the world.
Arise my host, my Unliving minions - bring me victory!
Vampires summon forth the gruesome remains of the ancient dead to bolster the masses of lesser minions under their control.
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
The first master of the Blood Dragons still walks among their ranks, and sees all that is done in his name.
A knight and his horse share a very strong bond – so strong that sometimes it can continue even after death.
Brought back from death to guard their Unliving masters.
Using a combination of their great strength and amazing speed, it’s easy for a Vampire to create a gap in their opponent’s guard.
Hellsteeds are vicious. Vampires that dabble in the binding of beasts delight in breaking these wild creatures to their will.
Many mortal champions change their attitude when their proud challenge is accepted by a dark creature whose very eyes are the eyes of death…
Just like their monstrous namesake, the Order of the Dragon are formidable adversaries for any foe.
A true knight will never abandon his armour; sometimes the steel skin appears to be part of his body.
It is to the Plain of Bones that a Vampire Lord travels to claim a Zombie Dragon as their mount.

A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.
The body of a Vampire looks human, but is capable of reactions so fast that even the quickest swordsman would look clumsy in comparison.
A Vampire's eyes are like deep pits within which mortals find their doom; the unfortunate victims can do nothing but stare, entranced by the deadly hunter preparing to strike.

If anything, this one has an even greater lust for life than they did before their death.

A coalesence of consciousness, the sum of which is much greater than its parts.
These deceptive creatures look so inoffensive and vulnerable that the enemy lowers his own defence, which is when they strike…
Who's queen? That's right… Now, prostrate yourself before me, worm!
How could a mortal resist the lure of a creature that has preyed on warm-blooded males since the dawn of time? Who could refuse to become her willing slave?

Nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing at them with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they appear.
As the powers of Dark Magic are wielded for the purpose of Necromancy, its unwholesome energies invigorate the Undead.

See the future, change the present.

The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.

Unleash the ravenous, primal force that dwells within.
The savage beast knows only rage and fury.

Ushoran's legacy is in safe hands.
Feed on the rotting flesh of the buried dead and grow strong.
Morr holds sway over the unreal, the stuff of dreams, ranging them against the Undead in all their nefarious forms.
Deadly giant bats the size of dragons, capable of plucking men from the field and stunning warhorses into paralysis.
Unlife inevitably changes kingly ways; Wights and other fell spirits serve the monarch, who rules over a populace of bestial Ghouls.

In time they will come to see that fear is a great motivator, and thank us for that gift.

Cows… people… they're all basically the same at the end of the day.
Summon my servants, the bats. I have need of their talents.
Hellsteeds are vicious. Vampires that dabble in the binding of beasts delight in breaking these wild creatures to their will.
Some Vampires can change into a wolf, a great bat or a whirl of mist. In doing so, they gain all of the advantages of their new form.
Come, my night-shape servants, we have a great work ahead of us.
Trained to survive against the harshest of elements, yet still but mere puppets to the masters they unwittingly serve.

Nocturnal spectres hiding from the light, addicted to your blood.
No beast can truly be controlled, but these desperate contrivances bring the smallest semblance of order.
The darkness within us all, given free rein to lust and gorge eternally.
“Rise, my friends, rise. Flesh and blood has its place, but spirit is the prize valued above all other.”
Evil takes flight; blotting out the moon on blackened wings, calling us to the dance…
The most impressive Nightmares are those reared on fresh blood. Such noble monstrosities are worthy mounts.
Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.
Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.
What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?
Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.
Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.
Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.
Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.
The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.
All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.
Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.
Always willing to fight on, a widened quiver allows arrows to rain, almost without end.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Nook and fire. Nook again, and fire. Nook a third time, and fire. All in a heartbeat.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
At times of great import, a single Red Crested Skink emerges from the deep jungle, claiming the title of the once and future Prophet of Sotek.
The greatest Terradon rider to ever serve the Lizardmen, Tiktaq’to’s daring stunts earned him the title 'Master of Skies'.
Rising to this position was inevitable, for no other Warlock Engineer is as influential as the infamous, devastating Ikit Claw.
Lord Kroak's power is that of a First Generation Slann, his connection with the Old Ones far greater than any of his living kin.
Inspiring and ferocious, this one is a true leader of his kin.
The greatest warriors flock to this leader, desperate to serve at his side.
A peerless warrior, dedicated to the Old Ones' work.
You cannot kill what's already dead.
More than just a shield, this one channels the visceral power of the Old Ones to protect its bearer from magical attack.
Mere walls cannot prevent Kroak from reaching his target.
After a great act of power and violence, the ability to quickly return to a state of grace is valuable indeed.
Kroak's ancient lineage provide a powerful telepathic link by which orders are conveyed and the Old Ones' will is reinforced.
As one of the First Generation of Slann, Kroak knows much about long-forgotten magics and ingenious, war-winning technology thought obsolete.
Those who serve the Great Plan are afforded the Old Ones' protection via ancient incantations and bygone utterances.
Nothing shall - or could - stand in Kroak's way. Nothing.
Mighty Lord Kroak spawns a small sun that, when it explodes, causes abject devastation… funnily enough.
Mighty Lord Kroak spawns a small sun that, when it explodes, causes abject devastation… funnily enough.
Mighty Lord Kroak spawns a small sun that, when it explodes, causes abject devastation… funnily enough.
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.
Unique and terrifying flying reptiles that are just as much a danger to their riders as the enemy!
It's not just for decoration, you know!
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
The Lizardmen’s habitat and eco-system shall be guarded against attack from without… and below!
So deft and agile is this one, they’ve almost reached Saurus levels of battle prowess.
Lustria’s temple-cities contain many fine structures dedicated to the Old Ones that stand in service of the Great Plan.
If you know the way, almost any beast can be tamed and set to one’s will.
With the correct leadership, the Lizardmen’s traditional workers and artisans can be trained to fight effectively.
Skinks spawned from the same pool are connected, strengthening and supporting each other in battle by their presence.
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!
Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!
More than just a fantastic orator, Tehenhauin leads his armies personally across Lustria in a crusade against the vermin parasites.
First comes the vermin, then comes the plagues, but it will end with the eradication of the Skaven - for they play no part in the Old Ones' plans.
Those who followed Tehenhauin knew the what would befall Lustria if they faltered. The prophecy must be seen through to the bitter end.
Sotek's children swarm to Tehenhauin's call, vicious serpents that turn the tide of battle in the Prophet's favour.
Sotek's prophecy spoke of ruin and destruction but also of hope; with the vermin menace eradicated, the Lizardmen would rebuild anew.
To fulfil the prophecy and overcome the Skaven assault on Lustria, Sotek gifted great power to his followers.
Idolised by his followers, Tehenhauin attracts the loyalty of some of the finest Skink spawnings in all of Lustria.
Word of the Serpent-God has opened many Skinks’ eyes to Tehenhauin’s holy cause.
Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!
Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.
Unique and terrifying flying reptiles that are just as much a danger to their riders as the enemy!
As Master of Skies, Tiktaq’to leads only the fastest and most resilient flying beasts.
Only those Tiktaq’to picks by hand may fight alongside him and Zwup up in the skies above the battlefield.
This magical rock causes a rather large explosion that stuns enemies, slowing them down for the kill.
This magical rock causes a rather large explosion that stuns enemies, slowing them down for the kill.
His sheer confidence in his own abilities causes Tiktaq’to always to lead the charge, often claiming his prize with the first strike.
With the utmost speed and agility, Tiktaq'to leads his death-defying Terradon squadron from atop his prized-specimen mount, Zwup.
Having honed his senses through myriad battles, the Master of Skies strikes at the most opportune time, emboldening his forces whilst breaking the foe's guard.
As one of the greatest Skink Chiefs to fight in service of the Old Ones, Tiktaq’to takes pride in training the next generation of Skink leaders.
Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.
Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.
Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.
Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!
Only the eldest, largest and most ferocious of their kind can move the Engines of the Gods!
There's nothing that cannot be conquered, even perfidious, duplicitous, treacherous fear.
Warp-energy is pulsing - through his veins a charge is racing. On a scale of one to ten, this one's operating on eleven!
This one harvests what he needs, forever on a quest to acquire the 'resources' made necessary by his research.
Although in a somewhat ad-hoc fashion, he nevertheless fixes things as he goes, managing to avoid more than a a few scrapes in the process already.
If you could once kill with it, this one can make it kill again, more and better.
This one's natural talents lend themselves to the technical side of construction, ensuring vital buildings stay mostly upright when they are required to do so.
A motorised ball of whirling, razor-sharp, eviscerating death, designed to plough through enemy lines with hellish vigour.
Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!
This advanced armour is infused with purest Warp-energy, making it more powerful than other protective measures employed by the Skaven.
Shake his hand? You'd better count your limbs, my friend!
Ikit is famed for his ability to mix magic with mechanical technology; this multi-layered Warp-infused armour affords far more protection than merely extra padding, therefore.
Enormous fun, and guaranteed to surprise the foe, but a proper nightmare when it cuts out mid-air!
Ikit is alerted to potential health issues by his multifarious inventions, by which ailments can easily be cured, ensuring he is always in peak condition.
Power surge now, exploding through, yes-yes-yes-YES!!!!!!
Be wary of one who can renergise himself in the middle of the battle, lest the tide be turned!
Warp-energy is pulsing - through his veins a charge is racing. On a scale of one to ten, this one's operating on eleven!
Treachery is always a risk; advancing others' careers can quickly become a fatal mistake. However, having accomplished students in your team can outweigh the dangers.
This new and improved device upgrades Ikit's earlier invention for maximum efficiency.
You can tweak and prime weapons to your heart's content, but there remains no substitute for a live ammunition test against an equally-murderous foe!
Finding assembly lines inefficient and therefore unsatisfactory, Ikit organises his Skaven workforce to manufacture his designs faster and better than the competition.
When the end finally comes, this one will be there, cackling like the supremely mad scientist he is.
Unlimited power corrupts the already-totally-corrupted utterly.
A motorised ball of whirling, razor-sharp, eviscerating death, designed to plough through enemy lines with hellish vigour.
Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!
Possession of this orb enables the user to inexorably drag the foe into a turbulent vortex of pain and death.
Markus Wulfhart's advanced tracking and slaying skills have earned him both a reputation and the recognition of Karl Franz himself.
Gor-Rok has sworn to protect his spawning-home, the Lizardmen's sacred First City of Itza, from any and all comers.
Revered as the living embodiment of the jungle, Nakai is an ancient Kroxigor compelled to defend Lustria wherever and whenever it is threatened.
In defence of the future, Hertwig is resolved to cleanse the world of its myriad impurities.
This one can follow the smallest of signs, the slightest of marks, no matter how well hidden the trail.
As they careen and stagger about, their flesh irreparably charred beyond recognition, perhaps the foe will rue the day they made war on the Empire?
Beware, ye foul, fell beasties, for your very doom approacheth!
It may be cruel, but the power to burn the foe to ash is extremely useful when you want to be sure of winning.
These arrows will kill of course, but are mainly used to cause a disorientating, explosive spectacle to unnerve the enemy.
Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Such advanced ballistic skills tend to rub off on one's subordinates.
The more, the deadlier, the merrier.
Those close to a Huntsman General benefit from his defensive capabilities and cool demeanour under pressure.
A lifetime spent hunting in the Imperial forests primes one to face a different kind of prey across the battlefield.
Knowing which leaves, roots, berries and mushrooms can be safely eaten, and which will kill you stone dead, is a distinct advantage on campaign.
Jorek is a highly-skilled Engineer, capable of seeking out and making the best use of the resources available to him.
When it comes to the art of survival, there's no one who can match Kalara's finely-honed abilities.
Having spent much of his time delving through archaic crypts and ruined temples, Rodrik has a keen eye for valuables.
Bears, Orcs, Kroxigor - prey-size is not a hindrance to the master hunter.
This traditional trapper's tool is a noose made from wire; if the foe struggles, it simply tightens, cutting into the flesh.
There’s no need to rush when your target has little prospect of escape.
Wulfhart considers it his sworn duty to dispatch the Emperor's enemies without the slightest hesitation.
Karl Franz's Captain of Scouts is the very best in his field; a hunter truly without peer.
Markus Wulfhart seems to almost bend the air around him – arrows and blades just seem to glance off, if they even connect.
The dense, dark forest of Middenland is the most unforgiving, inhospitable of training grounds, and the place where Wulfhart perfected his survival skills.
As you might expect, the very best hunters make for elite ambushers and skirmishers.
Blink and you'll probably be dead.
Deprive them of their eyes and they cannot shoot back.
Wulfhart is by far the most successful monster hunter and slayer anywhere in the Old World.
The past refuses to stay in its place, and bothers Hertwig like a thorn buried in his side.
Jorek's innate intellect means that, generally speaking, he is generally ahead of the curve.
Kalara moves swiftly, almost unseen, with a sleekness of purpose as well as motion.
Having spent most of his time living in the jungle, this feels like home.
A low body temperature means the Lizardmen can operate normally in environments which would overwhelm lesser races.
The enemy aren't going anywhere fast – in fact, they're not going anywhere at all!
Being able to slow the foe, drain it of energy and the will to fight on, is a mighty power to wield.
Dogged determination alone can keep one alive for centuries.
Cold consideration of the target, for just a second before it attacks with speed and aggression, are the mark of the reptile.
Smaller, weaker races frighten easily afore the size and aggression of the Kroxigor.
Rock-hard muscles and razor-sharp teeth bolstered by a tough, fleshy screen make the Kroxigor almost indestructible in battle.
Death surely awaits you with sharp and pointy teeth!
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
A Lord from the Lizardmen's hallowed First City can summon his spawn-kin to battle in Lustria's defence.
The stamina of the Great White Lizard is almost inexhaustible, unlike that of his pitiful opponents.
The solid centre around which the Saurus battle lines advance, and the rock on which Itza's enemies are broken.
Venerable Old Ones, guide my claw and restore my kin!
Never retreat, never surrender. Stare hard into the abyss.
A fighting machine, wholly purposed for war and the slaughtering of enemies, Gor-Rok can always be found where the fighting is thickest.
The greatest and most renowned of his kind, Gor-Rok's lone spawning and distinctive colouring immediately marked him as a future champion.
Younger Slann’s determination to involve themselves in worldly affairs has not yet been dampened by age. They are faster to rouse themselves to war when Chaos looms.
Slann of this spawning generation are powerful magic-users able to command the Winds of Magic to their will.
Slann of the Third Generation have not yet lost their interest in imparting their vast wisdom to their cohorts, though they would rather not stand up while doing so.
Life in the jungle means knowing the difference between which flora can heal and what, if ingested, will kill you.
Nakai's very presence indicates that a battle of great importance will soon occur.
So many Daemons of Chaos have been slain by Nakai that such entities fear to tread the same ground as him.
Slowly, carefully, the serpent uncoils, before striking suddenly – like lightning – and sinking its fangs as far as they will go.
Revered as a jungle-spirit made manifest, ancient Nakai is the last of the First Spawning, and fights with the Old Ones' long-dormant fury.
Nakai is treated with deference by the Skink Priests, who adorn his massive, battle-scarred body with ceremonial tokens when he returns from the fray.
This mighty protector of the Lizardmen race is pledged to go wherever the Great Plan deems it necessary for him to be.
One would imagine being the size of a small island would hinder stealth. The sorcerers weaving spells of misdirection in the hold would beg to differ.
Men of great size and stature have an easier time inspiring others, the mere sight of them instilling courage in their brethren.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
The impossibly dense iron of Henri’s custom-built chainmail would undoubtedly weigh down lesser – and smaller – men than he.
Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or Dragon!
Henri le Massif’s unique virtues make him almost indomitable in the face of the largest and most fearsome abominations.
“The Undead scourge must be destroyed. The Lady hath spoken.”
Commandeered as a rider-less warhorse of a slain Knight, Suleman boldly charges Repanse into battle at the apex of her feared lance formation.
In the eyes of the brave, danger gleams like sunshine.
If you wish to find an enemy, you need merely throw a stone.
Honour and purity are the wings with which the righteous soar above their peers.
Toss down your blade and pick up the plough, these lands are ours now!
Knights, peasants, and everyone in between feel honour-bound to follow Repanse to death or glory.
Beastmasters share their minions’ belligerence, cutting down foemen with lash, spear, and harpoon before claiming their twitching bodies as fodder.
Since Sulekh’s death, her children continue to fight in the Beastmasters’ ranks in the name of vengeance for their fallen ancestor.
The strength and willpower required to break in the extremely stubborn Cold One reptiles as war steeds is innately abundant in most High Beastmasters.
The wrangling of the wrathful Bloodwrack Medusae directly from their squalid subterranean lairs is not a job for the faint-hearted.
It matters not the nature of the beast; eventually, all submit to the Beastmaster’s will or perish under his lash.
The most colossal monsters of land and sea are prizes beyond treasures to the Beastmaster, requiring colossal empathy to control.
The startling crack of the Beastmaster’s hefty and ever-so-slightly serrated whip of Dragon-sinew suitably infuriates the beasts for battle.
The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.
Dark Elf Beastmasters roam the wilds atop their dreaded chariots, armed with barbed nets and harpoons to slay the foe and ensnare their prey.
The honing of a Druchii's affinity with animals assures that the bestial ranks heed his imperious command with obedience.
Larger than most others of its kind, the ferocious Cold One named 'Spite' is truly a creature fit for a heartless murderer like Malus Darkblade.
He is unnatural; an aberrant of the darkest kind. To lay eyes upon him in battle stirs a primal fear in the hearts of men and Elves alike.
The Lord of Ruin is coming for you. Onwards, beast of the deep earth!
With hate, all things are possible.
Sleepless nights afford the Lord of Hag Graef time to viciously and efficiently tackle tedious matters. Like taxes, always taxes...
Every moment of silence is but a slaughter yet begun.
Each sip of the elixir is a harsh reminder of what he has become.
Malus does not bleed, nor feel pain. Such expressions of the flesh have long since fallen away.
Wounds of the body can be unmade, for they are immaterial and insignificant.
“If nothing else, Malus Darkblade, you can be counted on to react to adversity with as much violence as is physically possible."
Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.
Magnificent chariots, gifted to those who have impressed with their devotion, bravery and prowess in battle.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.
It is often the arrogant pursuit of their own unique enthusiasms and ambitions that distinguishes the noble-born from the low-born.
Those with darkest, most self-serving ambitions will always find a way to see them through to fruition.
Reaching any position of power is an indication of great strength in Druchii society, for they do not tolerate nor risk a weakling’s presence.

The Realms of Man must not fall. Our fate is intertwined with theirs, and if they fall, so too do we. For this reason, I taught their first masters of magic, and for this reason, we must not abandon Men, despite their barbarous ways.
Black Arks are helmed by Druchii as indomitable and unbreakable as their iron ramparts.
Hailing from northern Bretonnia, Henri is as much mountain as man, and an expert when fighting large opponents, especially the most dangerous, horrifying beasts imaginable!
To the smallfolk of Bretonnia, Repanse is their champion – a beacon of hope in what would otherwise be lives of hopeless, downtrodden drudgery.
Hag Graef’s greatest tyrant is legendary in Naggaroth; an exceptional warrior and feared leader whose hatred can drive him to overcome any opposition.
Regardless of the mark, Snikch always finds a way to get close. Regardless of the Nightlord’s motives, the Deathmaster always sees his master's will done.
Beware the concealed weaponry of those trained in the art of delivering death from the shadows…
Those of Eshin knowledgeable in the Cathayan art of war are few and far between, using their learned secrets to advance their brood’s malevolence.
Innovative eastern techniques of armour assembly make it slightly less dangerous for the Sorcerer to be in range of their enemies’ attacks.
When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.
A curious combination of far east invention and Skryre ingenuity, the Cracklebomb contains staggering explosive power in a small package.
Most of the other clans struggle to find the patience to deal with such things as 'paperwork' – another weakness that Clan Eshin ruthlessly exploits!
Snikch leaves his distinctive symbol traced in blood beside his victims, so others will know the Deathmaster is abroad, and live in mortal dread.
As it turns out, the more important the murder, the more likely they are to be carrying something worth 'appropriating'.
With almost un-Skaven-like focus, Snikch moves unseen through the battlefield until the moment of murderous truth.
By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.
All races have moments of weakness – times when their back is turned and their friends are looking the wrong way.
They cannot hit what isn't there.
Time and time again, Snikch has proven that no wall, no castle and no hidden hole will save you from his Weeping Blades.
Eshin Assassins are experts are exploiting the briefest vulnerabilities. Bursting out of the darkness to end lives with uncanny skill.
The Skaven are renowned for their cheap shots and sucker punches, but the Assassins of Eshin are masters of both!
Make no mistake – in most cases, a Master Assassin’s training is quite literally a baptism of fire.
Dis ere's my choppa. Dere's many like it, but dis one is mine!
YOU'ZE NOT DEAD 'TIL I SAYS YOU ARE!!!
You scared of dem gits? I’ll give ya somefink ta be scared of!
If you fink some pointy spearz iz gonna stop me, den you'ze dead wrong.
Sir, there's a Greenskin approaching the camp!\\n\\n"Just one?"
Grom's appetite cannot be contained merely to the culinary realm…
Paint it red! More spikes! Bigga wheelz! STIKK SOME BOMBZ ON THE BACK!
Like any good Warboss, Grom understands well the art of getting back up after every setback.
Every settlement keeps the fires stoked and the meat burning in case Grom decides to show up for an impromptu snack.
Those of great stature often overlook the humble Goblin. Goblins, however, are almost preternaturally aware of nearby shins in need of a good stabbin'!
Grom's ridiculous girth provides some measure of protection against the weapons of his puny foes.
Grom is titanic – a bloated Goblin of such great immensity that every other gobbo looks up to him, both figuratively and literally!
Like a butcher’s cleaver, Grom uses the fabled ‘Elf-Biter’ to make tasty cuts of meat out of his rivals!
Along with his serendipitous standard-bearer, Niblet, who once somehow survived being sat on by him, the Goblin King’s banner brings inexplicable luck.
We're gonna dis-kum-bob-url-rate em good!\\n"Izzat even a word?"\\n"Dunno."
Ten Goblins? Inconvenient.\\nA hundred? Alarming.\\nA thousand? \\nUh oh!
All manner of things may be found inside a net of Dead-things. From horrid rotten morsels to still live enemy combatants, stored for easy snacking.
The River Troll Hag is never without her signature coating of thick swamp slime, which can turn sword and axe away with disturbing undulations.
No Greenskin would be so foolish as to act out of turn around a River Troll Hag, lest she decide they require her (often fatal) attentions.
This Boss is especially sneaky, able to deploy deep in enemy gits' terrain before battle.
Each axe bears the scars of generations of use; each strike fells with the strength of all those who struck before.
No hill, tree or valley is an impediment to these seasoned veterans of the forest.
War lions which have remained in service for long enough develop a true bond with their handlers.
Those who employ War Lion Chariots benefit considerably from the ferocity of the huge, snarling cats, keeping foes exposed to their cleaving weaponry.
Mere talent alone is not enough, one must be truly gifted to be chosen to study at the Tower of Hoeth.
An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.
Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.
Those atop the mighty Moon Drakes are steeled in the knowledge of their mount’s enlightened strength that has seen them face down Daemons.
