I set down my lance, symbol of duty\\nI spurn those whom I love\\nI relinquish all and take up the tools of my quest\\nNo obstacle will stand before me\\nNo plea for help shall find me waiting\\nNo moon will look upon me twice lest I be judged idle\\nI give my body, heart and soul to the Lady whom I seek...
Kholek Suneater has awoken, and all the world shall tremble at his wrath!
Like all Shaggoths, Kholek is covered by a thick, spiny carapace that is impervious to almost everything.
It takes something the size and strength of a mighty Dragon Ogre to defeat and kill a Giant, and it just so happens that there is one on hand…
A titanic blow delivered by Kholek's gigantic warhammer is tantamount to the tectonic plates beneath the world shifting and colliding.
Kholek is abroad once more, with his army of Ruined souls in tow. Beware, world!
Whenever the sky darkens with cloud and thunder rumbles on the horizon, all who know of the legend of the Suneater shiver in fear.
Only the very best candidates may serve at the right-hand of the Everchosen.
Blacker than black and far harder than any armour ever forged by mortal-hand, there is... something of the abyss about those who wear it.
To fight in Archaon's army, you *must* bear the Mark.
Archaon is truly the Herald of the Apocalypse, blessed with dreadful artefacts and even more dreadful minions, whose only purpose is to bring about the End Times.
The Everchosen stirs from his dark throne and prepares the blow that shall split the world asunder; these Heroes - who once were men - shall be his sword.
And wherever they tread, the ground will blacken. And what they touch will wither to dust and blow away.
Being unable to contemplate anything other than their own perverse needs and desires would be a handicap for anyone else, but not so Sigvald the Magnificent.
I know, I know - I truly am a perfect specimen. Hold the mirror a bit higher… higher! Yes that's right…
What think you of this particular suit of armour? I think the gold really captures my best aspects - all of them hahahaha!
Sigvald inspires fanatical devotion in his followers, for they know that in the aftermath of battle they may sate their most unholy lusts without restraint.
Sigvald's sycophantic minions will do anything to stay in his favour, not realising that he cares for none but himself and the attention of the Dark Prince, Slaanesh.
On sight of Sigvald's undeniable magnificence the enemy must confront their own obvious inadequacies, and despair.
A throwback to the High Kings of old, Thorgrim seeks to unite the Karaks and reclaim their lost Holds.
That which is wrong with the world that cannot be fixed with the blades of our axes, we shall surely avenge!
Mighty vengeance requires some truly serious firepower.
In his noble, avowed quest to return Karaz Ankor to its former glories, Thorgrim has commissioned research into new and improved engineering and runecraft.
They'll be 'ruined' alright - by me, with my mighty axe!
Those horrible gits will rue the day!
So ungrateful - after all we've done for them! Time to teach the umgi a lesson they won't forget!
What to do, what to do? You just won't stay dead, will you? Diiiiie!!!
Those lanky, aloof, untrustworthy Elves - I'll give them a brand new War of Vengeance!
Gelt's mask of gold both covers up the results of the explosion that almost ended his life and affords considerable protection to its wearer in battle.
In his younger years Balthasar showed great promise when it came to understanding the medicinal properties of minerals and herbs.
What ingenious technological advance is this, that affords Imperial artillerists more and better ammunition with which to smite Karl Franz's enemies?
By increasing the density of the shot stockpiles with which his army travels, the guns of the Empire rain devastation down upon their foes.
Possessed of a fierce intelligence and remarkable magical skills, the youngest Wizard ever to become Patriarch of the Gold College is known - and feared - throughout the land.
There is no one known to possess greater knowledge in alchemical matters than Balthasar Gelt, so great is his understanding of the mystical Lore of Metal.
The infantry under his command gain renewed courage as their blades are reinforced by the Winds of Chamon.
If we die, we will die wielding our swords, for there is no better death for a warrior.
Karl Franz has been hailed as an innovative tactician and a valiant general. Only the bravest and best may fight at his side.
Followers of the Emperor are inspired by his presence to attain levels of excellence and personal loyalty they never thought possible.
We will sit at Sigmar's banquet like the heroes of old and our names will be remembered in our people's songs until the end of time!
Thanks to Karl Franz's tireless efforts on behalf of his people, the Empire has flourished during his reign as never before.
Although Karl Franz walks a path many have trodden before, few - if any - have done so with such perfection and grace.
Held aloft and kept there by the rampant lunacy of their leader, Azhag's forces are all the stronger for his insane presence.
Azhag's mysterious crown whispers fell plans and dastardly schemes; sometimes he understands them and passes the general gist to the Shamans in his army.
There are some who whisper that the Slaughterer's wild schemes are not sufficiently Orcy. Needless to say, the crown normally lets him know so he can weed out the dissenters.
Enchanted armour and weapons, and the influence of the crown, allows Azhag to 'let go' somewhat on the battlefield!
When the crown takes control Azhag falls into a trance, his eyes cloud over and he mutters and even argues with himself…
Grimgor fears no injury, but despite his war-ravaged appearance has an unmatched knack for avoiding it.
When a Black Orc’s not-inconsiderable dander is up, you definitely *don’t* want to get in his way!
Grimgor is bigger 'n' 'arder 'n' betta than orl yoo uvver gits!!!
Black Orcs are the biggest, strongest, meanest, and most brutal of all Greenskins. Even by those standards, Grimgor is big, strong, mean, and brutal!
Yoo just pop a couple under yer tongue and 'bosh', everyfing in yer way gets a right royal twattin'!
Considering he is a complete and utter git, Grimgor's leadership, personal bravery and combat prowess are more than impressive.
Atypical of his savage, stupid kind, Throgg is possessed of a grim, malevolent cunning that raises him far above his peers.
Born to slaughter in their Ruinous names, Wulfrik bears the Mark of the Dark Gods upon his flesh.
A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.
The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.
They can see the Winds of Magic's ebb and flow, enabling them to make the best use of the magical power available.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.
The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.
The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.
The Dark Gods reward any pragmatic technological advances devised to wage war in their names by greatly improving their capabilities and performance.
There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
Thusly, the virulent maladies of the Crow are borne forth to repulse and infect its mortal foes; there lieth victory eternal.
The Great Hound of War thirsts eternally for blood and slaughter, its rage manifesting itself in the unstoppable martial spirit of its warriors.
The Eagle weaves a complex web of duplicity around its servants, further bracing their combat abilities in subtle, unexpected ways.
Dining upon the blood of slaughtered enemies may attract the notice, and maybe the favour, of the Hound.
The Hound's unearthly fury is personified by its Champions' thirst for war and hunger for unending blood and violence.
The Serpent's temptations come in many forms, all of them designed to appeal to the twisted desires buried deep within us all.
Seductive images of sensual luxuries may tempt the enemy from their chosen paths onto roads much, much less travelled and from which there can be no return.
Unstable and miscreated, the Crow's strength spreads and grows like the most successful of diseases, consuming all before consuming itself and beginning again.
This foetid, disgusting pus is so repulsive to the untainted that it mimics traditional armour of far greater substance.
Although the youngest of the Dark Gods, the Serpent is no less potent and can bind mortals to eternal service with alluring visions or tantalising temptations.
As the undisputed master of magic, the Eagle uses complex sorcery to influence its followers and draw opponents into his multifarious, interwoven schemes.
More fool they who go to war and quest with minds unfocused, for they risk the Eagle's desolate, underhand deceptions.
In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.
Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.
There is no other choice. There never was.
No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.
Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.
Well-accustomed to the harsh northern elements, these dark riders have further been steeled by many instances of blood-soaked triumph.
The Warhounds who reside in the far north are much hardier, more vicious and infinitely deadlier than others of their already-savage kind.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Ruin subtly corrupts a populace from the very depths of their souls; the resultant favour feeds the Dark Powers' servants and spurs them ever onwards.
Such utterly ludicrous, impossible geometry could not conceivably be the product of a sane mind; sight of it drives the untainted mad and melts their brains!
Violence bordering on absolute delirium; 'berserk' doesn't even come close.
Werekin flesh is scored with the symbols and marks of the Dark Gods, granting additional arcane protection to their ravaged physical forms.
The raw, corrupted hide of the Skin Wolf, scarred from its many spontaneous transmogrifications, forms a protective, armour-like layer.
The Dark Gods influence extends to the ferocity of their servants' attacks, increasing their power and reach manyfold.
Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
Maybe it is the near-constant state of regeneration that gives the hide a toughened sheen, almost impervious to claw, talon or blade.
Who needs a cumbersome blade when the perfect weapon is literally at your fingertips?
Witlessly stupid, yet bone-crushingly powerful. Do not be deceived.
The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!
The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.
Although corrupt with change and frozen to the very core of their icy hearts, the Chaos Frost Dragons of the northern wastes are no less vicious for it.
The Troll King's horde control the wind-whipped hinterlands of Troll Country, and may yet extend their despoiling influence much further afield.
Brooding upon his rocky throne, Throgg has pledged to fight all comers, with all the monsters of Troll Country at his side.
The uncanny ability of quickly regenerating even the most grievous wounds; in due course, almost all will be healed.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
Skin Wolves in the Wanderer's service enjoy speed and skill beyond even their preternatural capabilities.
Towering mountains of muscle and flesh, these War Mammoths give Wulfrik's tribe the edge over all comers.
Once Wulfrik has made his infernal offerings, the mangled gore that remains is devoured by his ravenous, insatiable Werekin.
Cursed to wander the length and breadth of the world, his never-ending quest to challenge and best the most gifted warriors.
There's no outrunning the terrible, flying Longship known as the 'Seafang'; once in its sights, an agonising, merciless death is your only possible destination.
Beware drunken boasts made in sight of the Dark Gods, lest they hold you to such claims…
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.
Cursed to seek the deadliest opponents to best and kill in single combat, Wulfrik must forever walk the world.
The weight of every single insult, grievance, umbrage and ill-feeling, channelled into a single, crushing swing of the axe.
It's a crazy piece of acrobatics, for sure, but it might just work; if it does, the opponent has no chance.
Come back here, you cowardly piece of green filth and take what's coming to you!
I thought I killed you already! Back for some more? Take that!
I'm not afraid of you - my beloved Ancestors are older and wiser than your dark, uncaring deities!
Those who take up the mantle of Slayer are steeled for the fight and enjoy Valaya's blessings and protection.
Those bound by Necromancy eventually degrade and fall. Krell, however, as Kemmler's chosen, has been afforded more time with which to kill in the Lichemaster’s name.
Having forever escaped the shackles of mortality with Kemmler's magical assistance, Krell will never stop - he'll keep coming back until they're all *very* dead!
Life without end; destruction without pause. Excellent!
The bite of this obsidian blade leaves behind Unliving shards that eat their way through the flesh to its victim’s heart.
Strengthened by the ages and Kemmler's necromancy, Krell's Chaos-infused plate armour protects him from degrading as other bound-entities eventually must do.
And I'll lead you all in the dance, said he - the relentless dance of the tireless Undead hordes.
Come to my side, my Undead servants. Now, you are bound, irrevocably, to my will forever!
To look upon this Undead Lord is to witness true and absolute horror!
Truly despicable to behold, this creature deflects blows with its turgid body.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
Never to be broken or dishonoured - never to succumb to the foe.
Never to be broken or dishonoured – never to succumb to the foe.
It is no easy task to bend or break the armour of this being.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
This one will not go down easily – it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.
The time to strike is now!
This being must be touched by Tzeentch, seeing things before they happen.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
This adept uses the Winds of Magic to seek out arcane artefacts.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.
Never trap this one, when cornered they have nothing left to lose.
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
Stay in one place, gods-damn you!
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
I spy with my beady eye… something that needs to be killed.
The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me.
The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me.
From the verdant depths, the Lady rises to protect the faithful.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
Thou shalt be everywhere and always the champion of the Right and the Good against Injustice and Evil.
Although nothing can replace the thrill of the charge and the righteous clash of steel, seriously heavy artillery generally helps.
The bloodline of the noblest of all steeds has been preserved; it serves us still.
Like the lion, this one is the biggest and the bravest of his kind... with the sharpest teeth.
Even stupid peasants can learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.
When the alternative probably involves being killed by their own side, the smallfolk tend to rise to the occasion...
Led by noble example, peasants fight longer and harder lest their Lord be dishonoured.
Lords must not be concerned with the collecting of taxes; there are others whose lot it is to feel the people's scorn.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
They've seen the Lady's acts or witnessed her blessed grace.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The knowledge that they fight in the king's name, with his support, steels an army for the privations of the siege.
The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or Dragon!
A Knightly formation, in the Lady's name, to smash through battle lines; to defeat evil in the field.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
The greatest of the Hippogryphs for the greatest Bretonnian leader since Gilles the Uniter.
You will be the land, and the land will be you. If you fail, the land will perish.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
The king without a sword? The land without a king!
So great must the king's stature be that when battle is joined it is always with the Lady's blessing.
The Lady's blessing is a wondrous gift freely graced upon all Bretonnian subjects, should they but kneel and utter their devotion.
Acolytes too are blessed by the Lady's spirit, enabling them to resist magical attacks.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The already-fierce Chaos Steeds are often covered in heavy armour, making them even deadlier.
The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.
The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.
Doomfire is a gift from Khorne, to ensure the Hellcannons speak with extra fury.
Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
The legions march forth under their Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.
This Chaos Lord expects his charioteers to harvest many souls for the consumption of the Dark Powers.
The Knights of Chaos are a boon for any Lord ready to despoil, for that is the will of the Dark Gods.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
A pungent mix of fell unguents ensures the unholy vitality of one’s minions.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
The masses flock to the Lord of Chaos - a dread time will soon fall on the weaklings in the south.
You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option.
A Lord that was once part of the tribes - one who rode the great Norscan migrations - can summon his kin.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
I am no god's tool, yet I am Chosen, for there is no other that thirsts for the end as much as I.
Dorghar is the Steed of the Apocalypse, a gift from the Chaos Gods themselves to their ultimate champion.
Archaon is Lord of the End Times, crowned by Be'lakor, a creature of abeyance that's neither shape nor shadow.
The Swords of Chaos are Archaon's warband, a cadre of hardened companions that have been forged over many dread quests.
The already-fierce Chaos Steeds are often covered in heavy armour, making them even deadlier.
Chaos Dragons are anathema to the noble beasts of Caldor. They are now corrupted creatures ridden by malicious Lords.

These leonine beasts, with deadly stinging tails, are worthy mounts of a mighty Chaos Lord.
